instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGOOD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGOOD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWRGOOD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM1</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hello,

currently I'm working on a water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. There was corrosion on and around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> with a broken pad No 25. After trying to restore the pad i scratched too much and opened the underlying layer (GND). PP7103 is not shorted to ground but pin 25 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is now... Any ideas how the fix this the best way? Is it possible to short <SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM1</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM2</SIGNAL>?
The rest of the board seems to be good. I get <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGOOD</SIGNAL> and all other rails.

Thank you and best regards
DudiPupan

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM1</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do not try to make such a short between signals.
Try to isolate it with a bit of kapton tape, or UV cure paint.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://es.aliexpress.com/wholesale?catId=0&initiative_id=SB_20210329150605&SearchText=uv+cure+paint[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM1</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Just received the UV Cure paint today. Isolated the short to ground but still got problems with the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> I think. I don't exactly know where to Start to Look for the issue.  Would aperciate some help what voltages should be present here. I'm in S0 state but no usb activity or display.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM1</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM1</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
CPU is probably dead after such liquid spill.
I don't recommend to waste more time with this board.
